title: 113_s1001
content: The Act titled "Iran Export Embargo Act" imposes sanctions on the government of Iran under the Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012. The Act imposes sanctions on the Government of Iran for violating human rights, sponsoring terrorism, and engaging in terrorist activities worldwide. The Government of Iran is in violation of multiple United Nations Security Council Resolutions by refusing to suspend nuclear activities, developing ballistic missiles, and transferring arms to terrorist groups. The Government of Iran violates UN Security Council Resolutions by transferring arms to terrorist groups in Lebanon and Gaza, supporting human rights abuses in Syria. The President will block property of individuals involved within 60 days of this Act. The President will block property and transactions of individuals involved in facilitating significant transactions with Iran within the United States or involving a United States person. The President will impose sanctions on individuals who knowingly import, purchase, or transfer goods or services from Iran, as part of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. The President will impose sanctions on individuals providing underwriting services or insurance to specified persons under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, with an exception for those who demonstrate due diligence in preventing such activities. The President will impose sanctions on individuals providing underwriting services or insurance to specified persons under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, with an exception for those who demonstrate due diligence in preventing such activities. Persons described in the subsection include the state and Government of Iran, any entities owned or controlled by them, and those acting on their behalf as determined by the President. The President will impose sanctions on individuals providing underwriting services or insurance to specified persons under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, with an exception for those who demonstrate due diligence in preventing such activities. This includes the state and Government of Iran, entities owned or controlled by them, and those acting on their behalf as determined by the President. Sanctions apply regardless of public listing in the Federal Register or OFAC's list. Subsections (c) and (d) apply to the exportation, importation, sale, or transfer of crude oil from Iran 180 days after the enactment of this Act.
